verses.verse: There is<WH3426> an evil<WH7451> which I have seen<WH7200> under the sun,<WH8121> and it is heavy<WH7227> on men:<WH120>

a man<WH376> to whom God<WH430> gives<WH5414> riches,<WH6239> wealth,<WH6239> and honor,<WH3519> so that he lacks<WH2638> nothing for his soul<WH5315> of all that he desires,<WH183> yet God<WH430> gives him no power<WH7980> to eat<WH398> of it,<WH376> but an alien eats<WH398> it.<WH1892> This is vanity, and it is an evil<WH7451> disease.<WH2483>

If a man<WH376> fathers<WH3205> a hundred<WH3967> children,<WH2421> and lives many<WH7227> years,<WH8141> so that the days<WH3117> of his years<WH8141> are many,<WH7227> but his soul<WH5315> is not filled<WH7646> with good,<WH2896> and moreover he has no burial;<WH6900> I say,<WH559> that a stillborn<WH5309> child is better than he:<WH2896>
for it comes<WH935> in vanity,<WH1892> and departs<WH3212> in darkness,<WH2822> and its name<WH8034> is covered<WH3680> with darkness.<WH2822>
Moreover it has not seen<WH7200> the sun<WH8121> nor known<WH3045> it.<WH2088> This has rest<WH5183> rather than the other.<WH2088>
Yes,<WH432> though he live<WH2421> a thousand<WH505> years<WH8141> twice<WH6471> told,<WH7200> and yet fails to enjoy good,<WH2896> don't<WH1980> all go to one<WH259> place?<WH4725>
All the labor<WH5999> of man<WH120> is for his mouth,<WH6310> and yet the appetite<WH5315> is not filled.<WH4390>
For what advantage has the wise<WH2450> more<WH3148> than the fool?<WH3684> What has the poor<WH6041> man,<WH3045> that knows how to walk<WH1980> before the living?<WH2416>
Better<WH2896> is the sight<WH4758> of the eyes<WH5869> than the wandering<WH1980> of the desire.<WH5315> This also is vanity<WH1892> and a chasing<WH7469> after wind.<WH7307>
Whatever has been,<WH7121> its name was given long ago;<WH3528> and it is known<WH3045> what man<WH120> is;<WH3201> neither can he contend<WH1777> with him who is mightier than he.<WH8623>
For there are<WH3426> many<WH7235> words<WH1697> that create<WH7235> vanity.<WH1892> What does that profit<WH3148> man?<WH120>

For who knows<WH3045> what is good<WH2896> for man<WH120> in life,<WH2416> all<WH4557> the days<WH3117> of his vain<WH1892> life<WH2416> which he spends<WH6213> like a shadow?<WH6738> For who can tell<WH5046> a man<WH120> what will be after<WH310> him under the sun?<WH8121>
